subject: Re: [junit] Testing Complete Applications and Applets
msgSnippet: As for comparing expected output, you can set System.out to your capture device, then use regexp to match expected output.  You definitely *don t* want to
messageBody:
As for comparing expected output, you can set System.out to your capture
device, then use regexp to match expected output. You definitely
*don't* want to match exact strings.

T.

On Thursday, March 21, 2002, at 07:18 AM, Stephen Cheng wrote:

> In additional to performing unit testing, I need to test entire
> applications
> with main() and applets with init(). [Background info: I am working on a
> java software development tool] I need to compare the text output
> (system.out.writeln) of the complete application/applet against expected
> output. Is there someway I could do this?
>
> It appeared to me that I somehow need to simulate the enviroment that a
> complete application/applet runs in. I would love to hear any
> suggestions.
>
> Regards, Stephen
>
>
